intro: Canscora helferiana, commonly known as the Cape mountain catchfly, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are alternate and often covered with fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late spring or early summer.
